com.intellij.diagram.actions

Class DiagramActionWithPreparation<PreparationData>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.actionSystem.AnAction
      • com.intellij.diagram.DiagramAction
        • com.intellij.diagram.actions.DiagramActionWithPreparation<PreparationData>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.intellij.openapi.actionSystem.Toggleable, com.intellij.openapi.project.PossiblyDumbAware
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DiagramCreateNewElementAction, DiagramCreateNewNodeElementAction

    public abstract class DiagramActionWithPreparation<PreparationData>
extends DiagramAction
    This is special case of Diagram actions where the action is divided onto two parts. The first part is executed under read-action. That allows to show dialogs with code completion inside. The main purpose of this action is to collect data for write action and return it in the method prepare

    After that, if returned data is not null, it will be passed into method execute. com.intellij.diagram.DiagramAction will execute this method under write-action.

    Author:
    Konstantin Bulenkov
    See Also:
    DiagramAction
